title: Apple Or Peach Strudel
summary: Apple Or Peach Strudel might be just the dessert you are searching for. This recipe makes 8 servings with 234 calories, 3g of protein, and 1g of fat each. For 56 cents per serving, this recipe covers 5% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and vegetarian diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 16 minutes. Head to the store and pick up baking apples, baking powder, salt, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 27%. This score is not so outstanding. Try Apple Strudel (apfel Strudel), Peach Strudel, and Peach Walnut Strudel for similar recipes.

title: Bunny Eggs Kids Breakfast
summary: Need a gluten free, primal, and fodmap friendly morn meal? Bunny Eggs Kids Breakfast could be a super recipe to try. This recipe serves 6 and costs 77 cents per serving. One serving contains 244 calories, 10g of protein, and 22g of fat. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up bacon, blueberries, eggs, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 21%. This score is not so outstanding. Try Orange Bunny Rolls {Kids Can Cook Toosday}, Funny Bunny Eggs, and Kids Can Make: Biscuit Eggs Benedict for similar recipes.
instructions: Cook bacon in large skillet until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings in skillet. Drain bacon on paper towels.Add 3 eggs to reserved drippings; cover. Cook 4 to 6 minutes or until whites are opaque and completely set and yolks are beginning to thicken around edges. Remove eggs to individual serving plates; keep warm. Repeat with remaining eggs.For each bunny, place 2 bacon strips on egg for ears. Cut cheese strips in half to create whiskers; add blueberries for eyes.

steps.step: Cook bacon in large skillet until crisp.
Remove bacon from skillet, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings in skillet.
Drain bacon on paper towels.
Add 3 eggs to reserved drippings; cover. Cook 4 to 6 minutes or until whites are opaque and completely set and yolks are beginning to thicken around edges.
Remove eggs to individual serving plates; keep warm. Repeat with remaining eggs.For each bunny, place 2 bacon strips on egg for ears.
Cut cheese strips in half to create whiskers; add blueberries for eyes.

title: Mini eggplant pizza
summary: Forget going out to eat or ordering takeout every time you crave Mediterranean food. Try making Mini eggplant pizzan at home. One serving contains 240 calories, 12g of protein, and 21g of fat. For 70 cents per serving, this recipe covers 7% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 3. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. This recipe from Foodista requires pepperoni, sea salt, eggplant, and cheese. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around around 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and primal diet. Overall, this recipe earns a rather bad spoonacular score of 18%. Similar recipes are Mini Eggplant Parmesan, Mini Eggplant Crust Pizzas, and Mini Eggplant Parm, Roasted Cherry Tomato, Basil Pesto.

winePairing.pairingText: Pizzan on the menu? Try pairing with Sangiovese, Shiraz, and Barbera Wine. The best wine for pizza depends on the toppings! Red sauce pizza will call for a red wine with some acidity, such as a barberan or sangiovese. Add pepperoni or sausage and you can go bolder with a syrah. The Fattoria Viticcio Chianti Classico Riserva with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 34 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Fattoria Viticcio Chianti Classico Riserva
productMatches.description: A complex nose of sour cherry, ripe blackberry, cassis, and warm spices, a smooth and round palate, and a long finish. Blend: 95% Sangiovese and 5% Merlot.

instructions:
Put enough olive oil in the bottom of a pie pan to lightly coat the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with sea salt. Put the pan in the oven and preheat it to 350 degrees F.
Once the pan is preheated, add the eggplant slices. Cook for 5 minutes. Take the pan out of the oven and turn over the eggplant slices. Spoon tomato sauce onto each slice. Top with cheese and pepperoni. Put back in oven and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
Remove from the oven and serve.

steps.step: Put enough olive oil in the bottom of a pie pan to lightly coat the bottom of the pan.
Sprinkle with sea salt.
Put the pan in the oven and preheat it to 350 degrees F.

Once the pan is preheated, add the eggplant slices. Cook for 5 minutes. Take the pan out of the oven and turn over the eggplant slices. Spoon tomato sauce onto each slice. Top with cheese and pepperoni. Put back in oven and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
Remove from the oven and serve.

title: Baked Cinnamon Apple Wedges
summary: Baked Cinnamon Apple Wedges takes around around 45 minutes from beginning to end. This recipe serves 1 and costs 87 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 1g of protein, 1g of fat, and a total of 120 calories. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 2 would say it hit the spot. It is brought to you by Foodista. Head to the store and pick up apple, maple syrup, cinnamon, and a few other things to make it today. It works well as a side dish. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, paleolithic, and lacto ovo vegetarian diet. Overall, this recipe earns a rather bad spoonacular score of 32%. If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Cinnamon Oatmeal Baked Apple, Baked Apple Cinnamon Pancake, and Apple Cinnamon Baked Oatmeal.
instructions:
Preheat oven to 180 degrees
Cut the apple into about 10-12 wedges and mix it with the rest of the ingredients.
Place the apple wedges in a small baking dish or on a baking tray  aim for a single layer.
Bake in the oven for 10 minutes. The apples should be golden brown and cooked all the way through.
Serve while warm.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 180 degrees

Place the apple wedges in a small baking dish or on a baking tray  aim for a single layer.
Bake in the oven for 10 minutes. The apples should be golden brown and cooked all the way through.
Serve while warm.

title: Swiss Bircher Muesli
summary: Swiss Bircher Muesli is a vegetarian morn meal. One serving contains 356 calories, 10g of protein, and 6g of fat. For $1.27 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from Foodista has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. A mixture of apple, milk, muesli, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so scrumptious. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 85%. This score is amazing. Try Bircher Muesli, Low-Fat Bircher Muesli, and Bircher Muesli for similar recipes.
instructions: Put Muesli in a bowlPour milk to cover the muesli and mix in yoghurtCover and refigerate for a few hours or overnightWhen ready to eat, if the mixture is too thick, loosen with milk.Grate apple and stir into the muesli mixEat

steps.step: Put Muesli in a bowl
Pour milk to cover the muesli and mix in yoghurt
Cover and refigerate for a few hours or overnight
When ready to eat, if the mixture is too thick, loosen with milk.Grate apple and stir into the muesli mix
Eat

title: Cavatelli with Chicken Sausage & Kale
summary: Cavatelli with Chicken Sausage and Kale might be just the main course you are searching for. Watching your figure? This dairy free recipe has 645 calories, 21g of protein, and 11g of fat per serving. For $2.5 per serving, this recipe covers 26% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have cavatelli pasta, chicken sausage, kale, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 88%. This score is super. Try Cavatelli with Broccoli and Sausage, Cavatelli With Broccoli and Sausage, and Cavatelli with Sausage and Radicchio for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

instructions:
In a large pan, over medium high heat, add a drizzle of olive oil. Add the sausage links and brown on each side, about 3 minutes a side. Do not worry if it isn't cooked through, it will finish cooking in a bit. 

Remove from the pan and once cooled enough to handle, slice into rounds and set aside.In the same pan, over medium low heat, add another drizzle of olive oil and add the garlic and kale. Once the garlic is lightly golden add in the broth. Simmer for 15 minutes.While that is simmering go ahead and cook the pasta. I cooked mine in the pot of boiling water for only 4 minutes then drain it. I finish cooking it in the pan with the kale and sausage so they absorb the delicious flavors.Once the kale has simmered for 15 minutes go ahead and add the sausage back in and let simmer for another 5 minutes.Toss the cavatelli in and let cook for another 2-3 minutes. Sprinkle some grated pecorino over top and enjoy!

steps.step: In a large pan, over medium high heat, add a drizzle of olive oil.
Add the sausage links and brown on each side, about 3 minutes a side. Do not worry if it isn't cooked through, it will finish cooking in a bit.

Remove from the pan and once cooled enough to handle, slice into rounds and set aside.In the same pan, over medium low heat, add another drizzle of olive oil and add the garlic and kale. Once the garlic is lightly golden add in the broth. Simmer for 15 minutes.While that is simmering go ahead and cook the pasta. I cooked mine in the pot of boiling water for only 4 minutes then drain it. I finish cooking it in the pan with the kale and sausage so they absorb the delicious flavors.Once the kale has simmered for 15 minutes go ahead and add the sausage back in and let simmer for another 5 minutes.Toss the cavatelli in and let cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Sprinkle some grated pecorino over top and enjoy!
